DataElement.preferredName: Alcohol Use Assortment Volume Combination Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that indicates the type and volume combination of alcohol consumed by an individual.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: the alcohol consumption of a patient.

Concepts.definition: A volatile liquid prepared by fermentation of certain carbohydrates. Alcohol acts as a central nervous system (CNS) depressant, a diuretic, and a disinfectant. Although the exact mechanism of CNS depression is unknown, alcohol may act by inhibiting the opening of calcium channels, mediated by the binding of the inhibitory neurotransmitter gamma-amino butyric acid (GABA) to GABA-A receptors, or through inhibitory actions at N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA)-type glutamate receptors. Alcohol inhibits the production of antidiuretic hormone, thereby producing diuresis that may lead to dehydration. This agent kills organisms by denaturing their proteins.

Property.preferredDefinition: Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.

Concepts.definition: A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

Although the exact mechanism of CNS depression is unknown, alcohol may act by inhibiting the opening of calcium channels, mediated by the binding of the inhibitory neurotransmitter gamma-amino butyric acid (GABA) to GABA-A receptors, or through inhibitory actions at N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA)-type glutamate receptors. Alcohol inhibits the production of antidiuretic hormone, thereby producing diuresis that may lead to dehydration. ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::4: A glass container for holding liquids while drinking, or any other similar drinking vessel.: The achromatic color of maximum lightness; the color of objects that reflect nearly all light of all visible wavelengths; the complement or antagonist of black, the other extreme of the neutral gray series.: An alcoholic beverage created from fermented juice of fresh grapes or of other fruit or plant products.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A glass container for holding liquids while drinking, or any other similar drinking vessel.

The achromatic color of maximum lightness; the color of objects that reflect nearly all light of all visible wavelengths; the complement or antagonist of black, the other extreme of the neutral gray series.
An alcoholic beverage created from fermented juice of fresh grapes or of other fruit or plant products.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1: The traditional unit of mass. The avoirdupois ounce is equal to 1/16 pound, or 28.3495 grams, or 0.911 457 troy ounce.: A glass container for holding liquids while drinking, or any other similar drinking vessel.: The hue of the long-wave end of the visible spectrum, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 630 to 750 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation and whose hue resembles that of blood: An alcoholic beverage created from fermented juice of fresh grapes or of other fruit or plant products.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The traditional unit of mass. The avoirdupois ounce is equal to 1/16 pound, or 28.349 5 grams, or 0.911 457 troy ounce.
A glass container for holding liquids while drinking, or any other similar drinking vessel.

The hue of the long-wave end of the visible spectrum, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 630 to 750 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation and whose hue resembles that of blood
An alcoholic beverage created from fermented juice of fresh grapes or of other fruit or plant products.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) contained usually in a syringe or a small cup and is to be administered in full at once.: An alcoholic beverage in which the initial fermentation mixture is distilled in order to concentrate the alcohol, generally resulting in a mixture that is at least 35% alcohol by volume.

Concepts.definition: A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) contained usually in a syringe or a small cup and is to be administered in full at once.
An alcoholic beverage in which the initial fermentation mixture is distilled in order to concentrate the alcohol, generally resulting in a mixture that is at least 35% alcohol by volume.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::12: The traditional unit of mass. The avoirdupois ounce is equal to 1/16 pound, or 28.3495 grams, or 0.911 457 troy ounce.: An alcoholic beverage usually made from malted cereal grain (as barley), flavored with hops, and brewed by slow fermentation.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The traditional unit of mass. The avoirdupois ounce is equal to 1/16 pound, or 28.349 5 grams, or 0.911 457 troy ounce.

A carbonated alcoholic beverage made through the fermentation of sugars derived from malted grains; this beverage is usually flavored with hops but other herbs or fruit may be used to enhance its flavor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Observations and activities relating to behavior, such as smoking and ETOH use.
